member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.Width
member.summary: Texture width (in texels). The range is from 1 to D3D11_REQ_TEXTURE2D_U_OR_V_DIMENSION (16384). For a texture cube-map, the range is from 1 to D3D11_REQ_TEXTURECUBE_DIMENSION (16384). However, the range is actually constrained by the feature level at which you create the rendering device. For more information about restrictions, see Remarks.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.Height
member.summary: Texture height (in texels). The range is from 1 to D3D11_REQ_TEXTURE2D_U_OR_V_DIMENSION (16384). For a texture cube-map, the range is from 1 to D3D11_REQ_TEXTURECUBE_DIMENSION (16384). However, the range is actually constrained by the feature level at which you create the rendering device. For more information about restrictions, see Remarks.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.MipLevels
member.summary: The maximum number of mipmap levels in the texture. See the remarks in . Use 1 for a multisampled texture; or 0 to generate a full set of subtextures.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.ArraySize
member.summary: Number of textures in the texture array. The range is from 1 to D3D11_REQ_TEXTURE2D_ARRAY_AXIS_DIMENSION (2048). For a texture cube-map, this value is a multiple of 6 (that is, 6 times the value in the NumCubes member of ), and the range is from 6 to 2046. The range is actually constrained by the feature level at which you create the rendering device. For more information about restrictions, see Remarks.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.SampleDesc
member.summary: Structure that specifies multisampling parameters for the texture. See .

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.Usage
member.summary: Value that identifies how the texture is to be read from and written to. The most common value is D3D11_USAGE_DEFAULT; see for all possible values.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.BindFlags
member.summary: Flags (see ) for binding to pipeline stages. The flags can be combined by a bitwise OR.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.CPUAccessFlags
member.summary: Flags (see ) to specify the types of CPU access allowed. Use 0 if CPU access is not required. These flags can be combined with a bitwise OR.

member.name: D3D11_TEXTURE2D_DESC.MiscFlags
member.summary: Flags (see ) that identify other, less common resource options. Use 0 if none of these flags apply. These flags can be combined by using a bitwise OR. For a texture cube-map, set the flag. Cube-map arrays (that is, ArraySize > 6) require feature level or higher.
